definitions.definition: an instance of a particular situation; an example of something occurring.
the situation affecting or relating to a particular person or thing; one's circumstances or position.
examples: I'll make an exception in your case
synonyms: facts; way things stand; informalscore "if that is the case
I will have to find somebody else"

definitions.definition: an incident or set of circumstances under police investigation.
an instance of a disease or problem.
synonyms: victim "only urgent cases were admitted for immediate examination"

definitions.definition: a person or their particular problem requiring or receiving medical or welfare attention.
examples: most breast cancer cases were older women

definitions.definition: a person whose situation is regarded as pitiable or as having no chance of improvement.
examples: Vicky was a very sad case

definitions.definition: a legal action, especially one to be decided in a court of law.
a set of facts or arguments supporting one side in a legal action.
a legal action that has been decided and may be cited as a precedent.
a set of facts or arguments supporting one side of a debate or controversy.
any of the inflected forms of a noun, adjective, or pronoun that express the semantic relation of the word to other words in the sentence.
the relation of a grammatical case to other words in the sentence, whether indicated by inflection or not.
examples: English normally expresses case by the use of prepositions
